DOC.brief_summary: Adherence to the dosing scheme is the principal element of COC efficiency. On the other hand noncompliance seemed to be an inseparable element of any oral treatment. The aim of the study is to evaluate in everyday practice the relation between dosage errors and indicated factors, potentially influencing the compliance with the dosing scheme.
DOC.brief_title: Data on Oral Contraceptives Compliance in Non Stop Regimen
DOC.criteria: Patients at the age of 1850 requiring contraception, treated with oral contraceptives designed for the scheme 28 pills for 28 days. The decisions would be made at the discretion of the attending physician. Patients were not valid for analysis if the initial visit was before start of study in the country (retrospective documentation), or if they did not take oral contraceptives designed for the scheme 28 pills for 28 days.
